intro: Impatiens leggei, commonly known as the Malagasy impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and glossy, while its flowers are borne in clusters on slender stems. Impatiens leggei thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
